talk0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Notice_00>Huh?


Oh.<sp:5:1:0> You're the voe...


<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Sorry,<sp:5:0:0> I don't have time to deal with a voe
right now.

All my attention needs to be on preparing
to welcome the <clr:0000>out-of-town vai<clr:ffff>. The sand
shroud is making things difficult...
talk0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Notice>Huh?


Oh.<sp:5:1:0> You're the voe...


<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Sorry,<sp:5:0:0> but the children are sleeping
right now. Tread quietly and try not
to wake them.
It looks like the <clr:0000>vai from out of town <clr:ffff>have
adjusted to life here.

<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_00>Knowing that, it makes all the hard work
preparing for them worth it.
talk0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I suppose I can tell you. After all, your
situation is unique.

As it happens, young Gerudo aren't
traditionally allowed to interact with voe.

And for vai born outside town, when they
reach a certain age, they're summoned
back to Gerudo Town.
talk0028:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The two newcomers are <clr:0000>Aaqlet<clr:ffff>
and <clr:0000>Mattison<clr:ffff>.

You can easily tell which two they are—
they're very small!

Aaqlet's mother, <clr:0000>Perda<clr:ffff>, is working at
a...<clr:0000>frustrating shop<clr:ffff>, so she's rarely seen
around town.
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>I can tell Aaqlet misses her though.
She keeps going down into the <clr:0000>shelter <clr:ffff>to
look at <clr:0000>Perda<clr:ffff>'s picture...<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_00>But I think <clr:0000>Mattison<clr:ffff>'s arrival has cheered
Aaqlet up some. I see her smiling more
often, at least.
talk0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_01>That small vai over there is named <clr:0000>Aaqlet<clr:ffff>.


She recently arrived here along with her
mother, <clr:0000>Perda<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>But Perda started working at one of the
<clr:0000>shops<clr:ffff>... One that has a...<clr:0000>complicated
relationship<clr:ffff> with the town.
So she is rarely in the <clr:0000>shelter<clr:ffff> anymore.


<snd:Tired_01>That must be why Aaqlet spends so much
time looking at that <clr:0000>drawing on the wall<clr:ffff>
over there.
talk0029:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The two newcomers are <clr:0000>Aaqlet<clr:ffff>
and <clr:0000>Mattison<clr:ffff>.

You can easily tell which two they are—
they're very small!

<clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_00>Mattison<clr:ffff> arrived in a yellow balloon.
It was like the sun itself was coming to
set on top of the town.
She's always smiling, even though I'm
sure she's missing her parents a lot.

<sp:3:0:2:0800>But that little vai is like the sun, always
beaming brightly!
talk0004:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice>Huh?


Sorry, I still don't have time to deal with
you right now.

<sp:3:0:2:0a00>All my attention needs to be on preparing
to welcome the <clr:0000>out-of-town vai<clr:ffff>. The sand
shroud is making things difficult...
talk0017:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Greeting_01>Thankfully, this town is like one big family.


I'm sure that little one will get used to
living here soon enough.
talk0005:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Sad>Sorry, I don't have time to deal with you
right now.

<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I need to hurry and prepare to welcome
the <clr:0000>out-of-town vai<clr:ffff>.

The sand shroud is a real pain though...
talk0018:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Sad>That <clr:0000>new vai<clr:ffff> should be arriving sometime
soon, I imagine.

Though I guess the <clr:0000>sand shroud<clr:ffff> will make
it really hard, if not impossible, to reach
the town right now...
talk0019:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Notice>Huh?


Oh.<sp:5:1:0> You're the voe...


<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Sorry,<sp:5:0:0> I don't have time to deal with a voe
right now.

All my attention needs to be on preparing
to welcome the <clr:0000>out-of-town vai<clr:ffff>.
talk0030:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Greeting_01>Gerudo are like one big family. <sp:5:1:0>I'm so
excited to see the little ones grow up.
talk0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:QuestionNormal>Hmph. There are better times to visit
than when they're all sleeping...

It looks like the <clr:0000>vai from out of town <clr:ffff>have
adjusted to living in town. They run
around playing during the day.
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Please let them sleep.
talk0031:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I need to go check on the little ones
right now.

There are <clr:0000>vai from out of town<clr:ffff>, so I've
been making sure to keep a watchful eye
on them.
talk0032:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:TalkPositive>Sorry, but I'm feeling pretty drained.
I know it's still bright out, but I want to
head to bed.
If you've got some free time, it'd be great
if you kept the new <clr:0000>vai from out of town<clr:ffff>
company, OK?
talk0020:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Have you seen the little vai around town?
Little <clr:0000>Aaqlet<clr:ffff>?

She recently arrived here from out of
town, too, along with her mother, <clr:0000>Perda<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Tired_01>But Perda started working at one of the
<clr:0000>shops<clr:ffff>... A rather <clr:0000>frustrating shop<clr:ffff>...

In any case, we rarely see her out and
about anymore.

<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad>I think Aaqlet misses her a lot. She
spends so much time looking at the
<clr:0000>picture of Perda <clr:ffff>on the wall in the <clr:0000>shelter<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Thankfully, this town is like one big family.
Everyone is going to look out for her, no
matter whose vehvi she is.
talk0021:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Ease_01>Still, I'm glad the repairs on this place are done.
We should be ready to welcome the <clr:0000>new vai<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0022:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Sorry,<sp:5:0:0> I don't have time to deal with you
right now.

There's a<clr:0000> vai from out of town <clr:ffff>arriving
soon and I need to be prepared to
welcome her.
talk0010:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Huh?


Oh.<sp:5:1:0> You're the voe...


<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad>Sorry, but I need to go check on the
little ones right now.

There are <clr:0000>vai from out of town<clr:ffff>, so I've
been making sure to keep a watchful eye
on them.
talk0036:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>They sure are cute when they're asleep,
aren't they?<sp:5:0:0> After playing all day, they've
really tired themselves out.
Ha, and when they're playing, they go
absolutely everywhere. <sp:5:0:0>I bet these little
ones know more about town than anyone.
talk0024:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>Huh? <sp:5:0:0>Oh, you're that voe... I thought you
were one of the little ones waking me up.
talk0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>We prepared this room for <clr:0000>Mattison<clr:ffff> and
<clr:0000>Aaqlet<clr:ffff>, who recently came to this town.

But they're not interested in sleeping in
here. They want to sleep where everyone
else sleeps.
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_00>If that means they're comfortable here in
town, then I'm all for it.
talk0038:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>They sure are cute when they're asleep,
aren't they?<sp:5:0:0> I bet they're still playing in
their dreams too.
<sp:3:0:2:0000>Seeing them running around town playing
during the day...

Well, it makes us adults want to do our
very best to keep them safe and set good
examples for them.
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>In a way, these little ones are responsible
for keeping everything together!
talk0026:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Wakeup>All right, well, I'm going to get a little
more sleep now.

The bed is brand-new, after all. It'd be a
shame to let it go to waste.
talk0039:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>They sure are cute when they're asleep,
aren't they? I bet they're having happy
dreams right now...
<sp:3:0:2:0000>Most Gerudo sleep really deeply, you
know.<sp:5:0:0> We get high-quality sleep that way,
which helps us build up our bodies.
It's one of the reasons we grow quicker
than anyone else.

Of course, we sleep less deeply as we
get older...

<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>Ha! I'm told that when I was a child,
hardly anything could wake me from a
sound sleep!
